name: df
desc: This command is used to display a report of file system disk space utilization.

-B.name: Display using the specified block size

-a.name: Display disk usage of all files and directories (including hidden files/directories)

-b.name: Display disk block usage in 512-byte units

-h.name: Display disk usage in human-readable format (GB, MB, KB)

-k.name: Display disk block usage in 1024-byte units

-i.name: Display inode usage instead of block usage

content:
Example

  • Show all file systems: df -a
  • Display with specified block size: df -B <block size>
  • Display in human-readable format: df -h
  • Show inode information: df -i
  • Display in kilobytes: df -k
  • Show only local file systems: df -l
  • Show file system type: df -T
  • Show only specified file system type: df -t <file system type>
  • Skip specified file system types: df -x <file system type>
  • Skip file system types mounted at specified mount points: df -X <mount point>
